Overrall the food was interesting. My gripe about this place is that the food is unique but these small plates would be great compliments to other foods that they don't offer or are too expensive. The crispy potatoes would be great with the rotisserie prime rib, if only that wasn't $72...

Service was prompt and efficient. The waiter was attentive and came around to always refill our waters which I really appreciated. Most convenient part was the lazy susan. However the prices here are just mad. $14 for a small pickle plate? Nah. Will I come back here? Probably not, but I'm glad I tried it.

I normally let things roll off my back but I left that restaurant so disgusted I had to write a review. When we sat down, Savannah didn't even greet us! She was super loud asking us what we wanted to drink. My little 7yr old nephew innocently asked for more drink and again she was rude saying give me one minute. Another thing and final straw that made me livid was when she finally bright the food out. She gave the wrong plate to my brother in law who along with my sister ordered a vegetable plate. He kindly told Savannah what he ordered with the hope of getting it corrected. She then says everything that you all ordered is here you just have to figure out what goes to who. At that point I had to speak up. I told her I've been trying my best to be patient with you Savannah but you've been rude since we got here. She then begin to talk over me and tried to act as if I wasn't even talking to her. I said I need to see a manager. She had the audacity to say he's right over there. I went to him and explained what was going on and requested a new waitress. Neither he or Savannah apologized but he did send a new totally opposite and awesome waitress named Caroline and he offered my Mom a free dessert since it was her birthday. Yes we (family) took my Mom there to celebrate her birthday, needless to say it wasn't so happy . The food was good but because I received such terrible service from Savannah I'm giving them 2 stars. Maybe Savannah's family owns the restaurant and she felt entitled to act a fool but it was totally unacceptable no matter who you are! I will go back because the food is good and the other staff was nice.

The last time I purchased a car was in 1997 & my little mule 'Pepe' has been a great truck (SUV).  If you get out to Earnhardt Cadillac stop by & see Omar Shakhwar and he can tell you about my little mule.   

But today I want to tell what an amazing experience I had purchasing my latest auto a smooth SRX!  Omar was professional & attentive to my requests.  I contacted Earnhardt about an SRX I found via a web search.  Omar responded to my request but he had some bad news...the SRX had been sold.  Omar said he would keep an eye out for  autos meeting my criteria.  And we left it at that.

A couple of days later I contacted Omar & let him know that as a Costco member I was entitled to their auto program & I found that Earnhardt Cadillac was a participating dealer & while I wasn't sure I would benefit from the Costco program or that Earnhardt had what I was looking for, we agreed to an appointment on 06/15.  

I went to the appointment certain that I would not find a car or the deal I wanted.  Boy!  Was I wrong on both counts & happy to be wrong which is very much against my nature.  Omar showed me a gorgeous white SRX & when he shared the list price I shook my head.  He convinced my to take the SRX for drive & I threw in the towel within seconds and told Omar he had to make this deal happen because this was the car for me.  

Omar & the entire team at Earnhardt got work & not only did they meet my criteria but they actually did better.  The price came in under my minimum offer...who does that these days?  Earnhardt Cadillac does!  

I was in & out in less than 2 hours which included test drive, negotiation, application, finance & a tutorial of The CUE.  Everyone from Omar (coolest salesman), Toney Bates the funniest finance manager,  the sweetest receptionist (whose name I forgot to ask) & finally to Jordon & a nice gentleman who drove & delivered my new ride "Popcorn" (yes I name all my cars) home, all made this happen and made me feel like I was the only customer that mattered that day.  What an amazing feeling & experience.  

THANK YOU Omar & the entire Earnhardt team!
New Loyal Customer.
G.P. Vasquez

Great service! The ladies who helped me were very professional and knew what they were doing. They also have complementary mints keychains and wipes. I would recommend this place to anyone. The office is also very clean and smells like fresh apples when you first walk in. All in all they are wonderful people with great customer service! I definitely will be back to this place!

There are many good things about Costco and very few bad.  Let's get the bad out of the way first.  For years, Costco Tire Center was my goto for tires.  Then, the Michelin tires starting blowing up on me.  To be fair, I am hard on tires.  But blowouts are hard on vehicles, so I stopped getting tires at Costco. 

 I can't really think of much more bad, unless you consider they keep moving the inventory around, so you are always looking for that stuff you bought last time, because it's not where it was before.  Sometimes when you see that thing that you just gotta have, but cannot really afford it?  Well, you better bite, because it may not be there the next time.  Prices are great, but you have to buy in bulk.  This is okay for things that will keep, but stuff like bread and pastries- you better really like because you are either gonna get tired of them or they spoil.  I use a vacuum sealer for stuff I don't think will last.

I like that you can get more organic stuff now.  We buy as much organic as we can afford, and Costco is good for things like Half/half and eggs.  We go through a lot of half and half.  Gas?  you bet.  Always priced great. Anyway, been going here for years and I highly recommend Costco.
My friend lives around the corner. She walked by and saw the owner losing it on his wife and then he kicked a dog. Animal abuse is disgusting and I would suggest that no one goes to this place!

this is our second time to eat here prior to playing a charity poker tournament with Tony Stewart's race team.  I love the ahi tune and my husband ordered a pizza that was unbelievable crispy and delicious.  We always eat at the bar and it took awhile to get service or anyone's attention, but once we did, the server was attentive and
continued to refill our iced teas.  For the price the best place to eat in the MGM.

Tacos El Gordo were the best tacos I have ever had in Las Vegas. The prices for their food are reasonable. The staff is very friendly. There were no long lines and there was plenty of seating either indoors or outdoors. My favorite tacos were the Spicy Adobada. My sisters and I went to go eat there two days in a row. It hits the spot after a night of drinking. I will be eating here every time I am in Las Vegas.

My son went here for two years and loved it. I loved it as well. We would have stayed here but we moved to Washington. Now that I am trying out other daycares, I realize the WMG is a rarity. The staff from the teachers to the front office staff showed a genuine interest and care for my child. This daycare is one of the few things I truly miss in Vegas.

We went here for the first time for my boyfriend's birthday, and DAMN, were we all impressed.

To find such a cute, cozy restaurant in Mesa was great, but to find such a place of THIS CALIBER was just fantastic.  Everything we had was amazing (even the escargot!) -- the strawberry creme brulee was especially tasty.  

Also, as others have mentioned, S'Bistro is BYOB, which is wonderful particularly for Mesa.  If you bring a dessert, they'll keep it in the back fridge for you.  

I'm going back tonight for Christmas Even with a brand new batch of people, so I'll have to see if everything is just as delicious and wonderful as last time.
We decided to give this place a try because our first option (boiling crab) had a crazy wait time . Personally loved this place . Very tasty

I went to this restaurant with a group of 6 people, and we were lucky to get the best seat in the house. We could see Eric cooking right from our table. 

The cocktails we ordered were excellent. I think the show stealer for me were the Dim Sum appetizers; we ordered every single one on the menu and each was better than the last. Everyone loved the Pork Buns, which they prepare every hour during dinner hours. My favourite, definitely, was the Shrimp Toast. 

We ordered the Octopus as well, and two of our friends did not want to eat it. But even they loved it after a bite. The Polenta Fries were another classic with a twist and definitely worth ordering. 

The platters were the best part of the night, we ordered the General Sanders' Chicken the the Peking Duck. The Chicken had a wonderfully crispy skin and tender and juicy underneath. The Peking Duck was beautifully roasted; the wait staff brought it our table before slicing it up, which was a nice touch. 

Try the Smoked Milk desert, which is one the most unique and interesting items on the menu. I was skeptical by the sound of it, but it was delicious. 

The dining experience was made a whole lot better by the excellent wait staff, which was on point and made sure we didn't wait too long between items, and that the table was never too crowded. 

We spent more than 2 hours in the restaurant catching up and having a great time.

I was absolutely thrilled about the cleaning we received today. The team arrived within the window they were scheduled and started working right away until everything was spotless. And I mean SPOTLESS. I never knew my sink and bath tub could sparkle like that. We've tried two other services before and neither of them could get our bath tub clean. 

They provided a stark comparison with the other cleaning companies we've had before and we are going to schedule a routine cleaning with this company. They are more expensive than others, but I think the price definitely reflects how good they are.

I was excited when they first placed this location over in this area, but the fact that I eat here quite often just confirms that I'm a fat kid for Mediterranean food. 

If I'm just in need of a snack then my go to is ALWAYS going to be the Chicken Salad sandwich and a side of rice. If I'm super hungry or not planning to go out for the rest of the night then I will pick up an entree of Chicken or Salmon Kabobs. I'm allergic to black olives so they're always happy to accommodate my order with a double order of rice and yogurt dressing. 

This is a wonderful location and pretty convenient on the way home!

Alan & crew were great. 
Our move of about 3 rooms of stuff was to a storage locker about a 1/2 mile a way here in Tempe.
They were able to get our stuff into the locker by very good packing and arranging
They were careful, courteous, punctual and reasonably priced. What more can you ask
We will have them move our stuff in the fall,l when our new unit is ready

I was told that they were going to give me a 15 minute window and they just showed up however they did not give me a 15 minute window and I was not home and I called the office asked for a manager Nichole and she was very ride on the phone asked for owner she is out of country for two weeks and she told me after telling her I would be there in 7 minutes I would have to reschedule after I turned around and try to make it there she never called me back to tell me the guy left

If you value professionalism and attention to detail this is the place to go. All my cars end up here as soon as possible after we leave the dealership. My last one was my new Lexus GS F & my daughter's Corolla a couple weeks ago. I got the ceramic tint which is the best you can get (worth a few extra bucks in this heat).

They also did the clear XPEL body film to protect against rock chips on these crazy Vegas streets. So glad I have it!!!

You never know what cars you'll see in there from Lambos, Porsches Ferarri's to Camrys & Accords. It looks like they handle the tinting for a lot of the local dealerships.

Don't risk going to some sub-par outfit. Go over to Pro-Tect, you'll be glad you did!!!
